greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A Fibonacci-Pascal triangle read by rows: T(n,0) = Fibonacci(n), T(n,n) = n and for n > 0: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k), 0 < k < n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of table, flattened
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k = 0..n), n = 0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= T[n, k]= If[k==0, Fibonacci[n], If[k==n, n, T[n-1, k-1] + T[n -1, k]]]; Table[T[n, k], {n,0,12}, {k,0,n}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==0, fibonacci(n), if(k==n, n, T(n-1, k-1) + T(n-1, k)));
for(n=0, 12, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019
else: return T(n-1, k) + T(n-1, k-1)
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019
Flat(List([0..12], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019
xref: Cf. A000045 (left edge), A001477 (right edge), A228078 (row sums), A027988 (maxima per row);
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 15 2013
